intro: Columnea calochlamys, commonly known as the golden flame or red flame plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with glossy, dark green leaves. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by hummingbirds, which are attracted to its bright colors and nectar-rich blooms. Columnea calochlamys is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
